The Ministry of Electronics and IT (Meity) has issued a notice to the Chief […]

articles.title: Govt hikes excise duty on cigarettes, levies health cess on pan masala from Feb 1
articles.summary: New Delhi, Jan 1 (PTI) The government has imposed an additional excise duty on cigarettes and other tobacco products effective February 1, under a revised tax structure that levies the steepest increase on longer, premium cigarettes. The Finance Ministry has notified amendments to the Central Excise Act imposing an excise duty ranging from Rs 2,050 […]

articles.title: Indian Parliament in 2025: From VB-G RAM G to Waqf and Constitution amendment — Key bills that sparked debate
articles.summary: While the government did not accept the Opposition's demand for an urgent Parliament session after the Pahalgam terror attack, the discussions on it and Operation Sindoor remained a highlight of 2025. Take a look at key bills that made the Parliament roar with heated debates.

articles.title: Recognition, funding, autonomy. Educationists divided over single higher education regulator Bill
articles.summary: Vikshit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill proposes setting up an overarching higher education commission along with 3 councils for regulation, accreditation & standards of universities.

articles.title: Cabinet clears Bill to merge UGC, AICTE & NCTE; likely to be introduced in Parliament next week
articles.summary: Higher Education Commission of India Bill will establish a sole authority for coordinating & determining standards in higher education, research, and scientific & technical institutions.

articles.title: Winter Session 2025: Parliament clocks record productivity as reforms dominate agenda
articles.summary: From sweeping changes in rural employment and labour laws to liberalised FDI norms in insurance and nuclear energy, Parliament’s Winter Session reflected the government’s intent to fast-track structural reforms, even as several measures triggered sharp political and policy pushback.

articles.title: Tobacco stocks tank in early trade; Godfrey Phillips down 10%
articles.summary: From February 1, pan masala, cigarettes, tobacco and similar products will attract a GST rate of 40%, while ‘beedi' will attract 18% Goods and Services Tax (GST), according to a government notification

articles.title: Additional excise duty on tobacco, health cess on pan masala to be effective February 1
articles.summary: From February 1, pan masala, cigarettes, tobacco and similar products will attract a GST rate of 40%, while biris will attract 18% Goods and Services Tax (GST), according to a government notification

articles.title: Payments Regulatory Board: RBI charts vision for 2028 in first meeting
articles.summary: Members discussed the draft Payments Vision 2028, providing strategic guidance to further develop India’s fast-growing digital payment ecosystem where transaction volumes are projected to nearly triple by FY30.

articles.title: Fearless judges bedrock of judiciary, can’t be penalised for error of judgment: Supreme Court
articles.summary: The Supreme Court ruled that judges cannot face disciplinary action for errors in judgment, emphasizing that a fearless judiciary is crucial for the rule of law. The court expressed concern over frivolous complaints against judges, which can lead to trial court judges hesitating to grant bail, and reinstated a judge terminated for an error in judgment.

articles.title: 2025 was a busy trade year for India. King of Tariffs strain, FTA with New Zealand, UK & Oman deals
articles.summary: The year began with two major trade announcements—opening of negotiations for “first tranche” of a bilateral trade agreement with the US following PM Modi’s visit to Washington.

articles.title: Centre ready to revoke X's safe harbour tag to protect citizens: Govt officials
articles.summary: On Friday, the ministry of electronics and information technology (MeitY) had issued a formal notice to X over its AI-powered chatbot Grok being used to generate and spread obscene images and videos of women, and given it 72 hours to remove objectionable content, and take action against offending users. It also threatened to nullify the firm's 'safe harbour' status if it is unable to demonstrate auditable compliance with all rules, especially with regards to hosting sexually explicit content.

articles.title: CBDT Chairman Ravi Agrawal asks officials to be ready for transition to new I-T Act
articles.summary: The Income Tax Department is gearing up for a significant change. A new direct tax law will be implemented from April 1, 2026, replacing the old Act. CBDT Chairman Ravi Agrawal has urged officials to be ready and understand the new rules. Training and capacity building are underway to ensure a smooth transition.

articles.title: Delhi's EV policy 2.0: Govt to pay owners of old fuel cars for conversion into EVs, check new policy measures
articles.summary: The Delhi government has introduced a new vehicle rule aimed at reducing air pollution. It will provide a Rs 50,000 subsidy for the first 1,000 cars that need modifying to push people to convert their diesel/petrol cars into electric vehicles (EVs). The move is beneficial for those considering scraping or dumping their old vehicles as they would now receive an upgraded version of their old car along with an incentive.

articles.title: SC Assures Representation for Specially Abled Lawyers in Bar Councils
articles.summary: During a recent hearing, the Supreme Court emphasized the need for institutional representation of specially abled lawyers in bar councils, suggesting that statutory amendments may be necessary for future elections.

articles.title: Board of Payments Regulatory Board holds its first meet, reviews draft Payments Vision 2028
articles.summary: The Board reviewed the functions of the Department of Payment and Settlement Systems and current focus areas covering both domestic and global payment systems. The draft Payments Vision 2028 was presented, and Members gave strategic guidance to ensure the continued development of India's payment ecosystem, RBI said in a statement.

articles.title: 'Khelega India!': Sports, fitness may soon be part of skills training
articles.summary: India is integrating sports and fitness into its skill training programs, aiming to enhance trainees' physical resilience and provide a potential second income. This initiative, inspired by Prime Minister Modi's vision, will include mandatory yoga and self-defense training at skill institutes, with certification opportunities. The government also plans to develop sports infrastructure on campus, tailored to regional strengths.

articles.title: Govt. notifies February 1 as the end of GST compensation cess, start of new tobacco tax regime
articles.summary: In a series of notifications on New Year’s Day, the Finance Ministry announced the end of GST compensation cess, the increase in the excise duty on tobacco products, and the new GST rates on these items as well

articles.title: RBI issues amendment directions on related-party lending, allows non-compliant transactions with conditions
articles.summary: RBI will issue new lending rules for banks, NBFCs, cooperative banks, and AIFIs, tightening related-party transactions, disclosure norms, and introducing materiality thresholds from April 1, 2026.

articles.title: Delhi riots 2020: Supreme Court denies bail to Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam; allows others on 12 conditions
articles.summary: The accused were booked under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967 (UAPA), anti-terror law and provisions of the erstwhile Indian Penal Code (IPC), for allegedly being the "masterminds" of the 2020 riots.

articles.title: India-EU trade pact: Goyal to visit Brussels this week
articles.summary: New Delhi, Jan 4 (PTI) Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal will visit Brussels this week for talks with his EU counterpart on the proposed trade pact, for which negotiations are in the last phase, an official said. During the two-day visit on January 8-9, Goyal will meet the Executive Vice-President and European Commissioner for […]

articles.title: ‘Gross violation of AI’: MeitY gives X 72 hours to remove ‘unlawful’ content, warns legal action
articles.summary: The government has demanded that X undertake a comprehensive and immediate technical review of Grok including how it processes prompts and creation capabilities so as to not facilitate sexually explicit, unlawful content.

articles.title: MeitY takes cognisance of Grok misuse on X, action to follow soon: Secretary S Krishnan
articles.summary: The electronics and IT ministry has begun examining the alleged misuse of X’s AI tool Grok to generate obscene and non-consensual images, with MeitY Secretary S Krishnan indicating that regulatory action could be taken swiftly as scrutiny intensifies around platform accountability and AI safety.

articles.title: Why HC registry refused to delete names of Akshay Kumar, PVR & INOX from Bata’s Jolly LLB 2 suit
articles.summary: In 2017 defamation lawsuit, Bata took offence to Jolly LLB 2 trailer scene where Annu Kapoor's character sneered at Akshay Kumar's character by referring to his ‘Bata footwear’.

articles.title: Government withdraws import restrictions on low ash met coke with ash content below 18%
articles.summary: The Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT), on January 3, amended the import policy of Low Ash Metallurgical Coke, having ash content below 18%, including coke fines/coke breeze and ultra-low phosphorous metallurgical coke, to “free” from “restricted” earlier.

articles.title: India likely to retain 4% inflation target for central bank, Bloomberg News reports
articles.summary: India is expected to maintain its current inflation target for the Reserve Bank of India, with officials deeming the flexible framework effective. The target mandates 4% inflation within a 2% to 6% band, a policy due for renewal in March. This approach, adopted in 2016, has seen inflation remain within the band for most of the past decade.

articles.title: Budget 2026 outlook: Rethinking tax and regulatory policies for a new era of wealth creation
articles.summary: Modern wealth creation offers diverse investment choices. However, India's tax and regulatory systems lag behind this rapid evolution. The upcoming Union Budget 2026-27 presents an opportunity to bridge this gap. Reforms are needed to rationalize tax treatments, incentivize long-term investing, and simplify processes. This will foster entrepreneurship, attract capital, and drive inclusive economic growth for India.

articles.title: India mulls tax exemption for sovereign wealth funds’ equity gains amid heavy foreign outflows
articles.summary: India may exempt Sovereign Wealth Funds and patient capital from taxes on Indian stock market earnings. This proposal aims to attract stable foreign investment following significant sell-offs by foreign fund managers. The government is examining extending these benefits to other long-term investors like pension funds. Such a move could boost capital inflows into the Indian equity market.

articles.title: ​Unenviable choice: On the government’s fiscal policy space
articles.summary: Growth-generating capital expenditure can affect fiscal targets

articles.title: The Tencent-Flipkart test: Is New Delhi about to ease up on Chinese investment?
articles.summary: The government is weighing a proposal to exempt investments up to 26% from the rigorous security screening process mandated by PN(3), provided the foreign entity exercises no management control and holds no seat on the company’s board, two people familiar with the matter said.

articles.title: A year of insurance reforms in India, yet more ground to cover
articles.summary: Over the past year, India has rewritten key rules governing insurance. Yet for policyholders, the real test lies not in regulation, but in how these changes play out when a claim is filed.

As per the state-wise ranking under the ‘Deregulation 1.0’ report of the central government, the state has been […]

articles.title: Civic polls: Row over Eknath Shinde's remarks on voting and development funds
articles.summary: Eknath Shinde warned voters in Thane to support Mahayuti alliance symbols Shiv Sena and BJP, linking votes to government funds, and dismissed Uddhav and Raj Thackeray's reconciliation impact.

articles.title: Next round of Russia trade talks by Feb-end, India to focus on reduction of non-tariff measures
articles.summary: India and Russia, as a part of Eurasian Economic Union (EAEU), are set to hold the 2nd round of negotiations on a trade deal next month after the Union Budget.

articles.title: Born in a lab, Indian Statistical Institute helped shape new India. A bill intends to alter its future
articles.summary: Section of faculty, students and alumni oppose MoSPI's draft Bill that seeks to replace Indian Statistical Institute's elected Governing Council with government-nominated board.

articles.title: India-US trade talks, Trump and the China factor: Why New Delhi’s foreign policy faces its toughest test in 2026
articles.summary: As geopolitical fault lines deepen, former Indian diplomats warn that stalled trade talks with Washington reflect a broader strategic shift, forcing New Delhi to rethink how it balances the US, China and its own economic interests in a volatile global environment.

articles.title: Email ID ‘abc@gmail’, ‘111111’ as bank A/C—CAG flags gaps in Modi govt’s flagship upskilling scheme
articles.summary: Audit finds violations in age and education criteria, duplicate photos, unspent funds, and shut training centres in states surveyed; report tabled in Parliament.

articles.title: House panel calls for pen-&-paper exams by NTA after ‘leaks’, NAAC internal probe amid bribery case
articles.summary: Computer-based tests, if used, should be conducted only in government-controlled centres, a Digvijay Singh-led Standing Committee has said in Parliament.

articles.title: IndiaAI startups resist Centre’s plan to seek equity for support
articles.summary: The Centre plans to hold discussions with the 12 companies approved under the IndiaAI Mission to build foundational artificial intelligence (AI) models for the portion of the capital structure not covered by announced grants. One of the 12 companies approved under the scheme told ET that the government has asked participants to issue Compulsory Convertible Debentures (CCDs) as part of the investment structure.

articles.title: Union Budget: 5 engines India must fire to become a developed nation by 2047
articles.summary: India Budget: India's 2047 developed nation dream hinges on a multi-pronged growth strategy, with the upcoming Budget playing a crucial role. Key focus areas include empowering MSMEs, leveraging technology for efficient governance, bolstering infrastructure, increasing women's workforce participation, and boosting high-value manufacturing. These initiatives are vital for sustained economic progress.

articles.title: AYUSH gets recognition in India's free trade pacts with Oman, New Zealand
articles.summary: India's traditional medicine system, AYUSH, has achieved formal recognition in bilateral trade agreements with Oman and New Zealand. These agreements, finalized last December, include dedicated sections for health services and traditional medicine. AYUSH and herbal product exports saw a growth of 6.11 percent, reaching USD 688.89 million in 2024-25 from USD 649.2 million in 2023-24.

articles.title: PM Modi reviews progress on overseas critical mineral acquisitions, ₹1,500-crore recycling incentive scheme
articles.summary: The review covered India’s efforts to secure long-term access to key minerals such as lithium, cobalt and rare earths, while scaling up domestic recycling capacity to reduce import dependence and support manufacturing under the Make in India programme.

articles.title: Wipro now mandates six hours WFO in hybrid work tweak
articles.summary: Software exporter Wipro has tightened its work-from-office policy, mandating employees to stay at least six hours in office for three days a week, in a shift from the earlier flexible hours. While weekly three days of attendance at the office has been in place for some time, the six hours of stay between two in and out punches is among the additions to Wipro’s hybrid work policy in India.

articles.title: Samsung, SK Hynix, Micron shares rise as investors turn to memory chipmakers amid global supply crunch
articles.summary: Memory chip stocks are surging as investors anticipate further price increases. A global supply shortage, fueled by booming demand for artificial intelligence infrastructure, is driving this trend. Industry leaders describe the situation as unprecedented, with constraints expected to last for years. This demand is diverting manufacturing capacity, impacting supply for other sectors.

articles.title: Venezuela shock won’t spike oil prices soon; dollar still king, says Invesco’s Arnab Das
articles.summary: US action in Venezuela may not trigger sharp oil price moves anytime soon, says Invesco’s Arnab Das. Rebuilding Venezuela’s oil sector will take years, while dollar dominance remains intact. Gold continues to benefit from geopolitical uncertainty, and US tariff comments on India are seen more as pressure tactics than immediate trade threats.

articles.title: Tariff shock could weigh on jobs while easing inflation, Fed Research suggests
articles.summary: New research from the San Francisco Fed suggests steep US tariff hikes may ease inflation by dampening demand, challenging conventional views and reopening debate over interest rate policy.

articles.title: Why is BofA more bullish on India for FY26–FY27?  Rahul Bajoria answers
articles.summary: India’s GDP growth outlook for FY26 and FY27 is improving, supported by strong post-GST data, resilient consumption, public capex recovery and policy easing. BofA Global Research’s Rahul Bajoria expects autos and travel to lead discretionary demand, sees room for another RBI rate cut, and believes India can manage global risks despite geopolitical uncertainty.

articles.title: Mint Explainer: Why Trump's Venezuela shock is fueling gold, not crude
articles.summary: US action in Venezuela has revived fears over geopolitics, sovereignty, and the safety of paper reserves. While oil prices remain constrained by supply realities, gold is increasingly pricing in a more fragmented and coercive global order.

articles.title: Five Questions About Money to Ponder in 2026
articles.summary: Stablecoins had their ChatGPT moment in 2025. Payment tokens that were until now used mostly by crypto traders are raring to go mainstream, and not just in the US, where they got regulatory blessing through the Genius Act. Yet just because they’ve pulled ahead, it’s hard to conclude that these 1:1 representation of fiat currencies have won the race. In their quest to come up with the perfect money for the 21st century, market participants will grapple with at least five unanswered questions in 2

articles.title: Stamp duty waived on farm loans up to Rs 2 lakh in Maharashtra
articles.summary: The revenue and forest department issued a government gazette notification in this regard on January 1. The waiver has come into effect from that date.

articles.title: India launches anti-dumping probe into nylon-6 chip imports from China, Russia
articles.summary: India has started an anti-dumping probe into nylon-6 chips from China and Russia, prompted by domestic manufacturers' concerns over cheap imports affecting local industry. The investigation will evaluate the implications for pricing and market stability in the synthetic raw materials sector.

articles.summary: Update from Indian Express - Business

articles.title: MeitY, Grok, and the question of responsible AI
articles.summary: Allegations involving harmful AI-generated content have triggered a regulatory response that raises broader questions about platform responsibilities, the risks posed by generative AI, and India’s evolving digital regulatory framework.

articles.title: PAN-based GST registration: A path forward for bigger reforms
articles.summary: Eight years into the GST journey, significant progress has been made. India’s tax system has been unified, cascading taxes eliminated, and a common market created. Yet the reform remains unfinished. The next phase must focus on simplification—not only of rates, but of the entire compliance journey, writes lawmaker Dr. Sasmit Patra.

articles.title: Govt removes import restrictions on low-ash metallurgical coke
articles.summary: The government has removed import restrictions on lowash metallurgical coke, having ash content below 18%, according to a notification.

articles.title: Large taxpayers may soon have fully automated tax compliance systems
articles.summary: The central government has begun granting API access to tax portals, paving the way for AI-led automation tools for filings and compliance.

articles.title: Umar Khalid's FIRST reaction after SC denies bail in Delhi riot case: 'Ab yahi...'
articles.summary: Khalid remains in Tihar jail as the Supreme Court, in its verdict, denied his and Sharjeel Imam's bail, while granting bail to five other activists in the same case-Gulfisha Fatima, Meeran Haider, Shifa Ur Rehman, Mohd. Saleem Khan and Shadab Ahmad.

articles.title: Govt announces Rs 7,295-cr export package to improve exporters’ access to credit
articles.summary: New Delhi, Jan 2 (PTI) The government on Friday announced a Rs 7,295-crore export support package, comprising a Rs 5,181-crore interest subvention scheme along with a Rs 2,114-crore collateral support, to improve exporters’ access to credit. Both measures will be rolled out over a period of six years (2025-31). Additional Secretary in the Commerce Ministry […]

articles.title: No plan to change land acquisition policy, says cabinet secretary T V Somanathan
articles.summary: Officials said the PRAGATI platform has helped unlock stalled investments by resolving issues linked to land, environment and right of way, enabling large road, rail and power projects to move forward despite persistent structural challenges.

articles.title: Finding growth without overpaying is the real task now, says Axis MF's Shreyash Devalkar
articles.summary: Axis Mutual Fund’s Shreyash Devalkar said Indian equities are facing valuation pressure as most investment themes are already priced in. He is focusing on growth continuity and GARP opportunities, especially in potential turnaround sectors such as banks, lending, and parts of autos. He highlighted risks in high-valuation sectors, evolving consumption patterns in QSRs, and said inflation and policy cues will be key factors to track going ahead.

articles.title: 1 regulator, 3 councils: Inside Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill for higher education overhaul
articles.summary: Modi govt is set to introduce bill that proposes umbrella body for higher education, councils for regulation, accreditation. It will be headed by a chairperson appointed by the President.

articles.title: US manufacturing: ISM index records yearly low in December; activity contracts for 10th straight month
articles.summary: Update from Times of India - Business

articles.title: Juvenile at time of crime, man walks free after 13 years
articles.summary: A man, Mobin, has been released after serving over 13 years of a life sentence for a 2003 murder. The Uttarakhand High Court declared him a juvenile at the time of the crime, making his continued imprisonment unlawful. An independent inquiry confirmed his minor status, leading to his freedom under the Juvenile Justice Act.

articles.title: May tighten gun laws after Ballari clashes: DKS
articles.summary: Karnataka may impose stricter gun laws after a Congress worker's death in Ballari clashes, amid opposition claims of a government cover-up.

articles.title: $12 trillion needed for climate mitigation needs in Hindu Kush Himalayas: Report
articles.summary: India’s total climate finance need for the 2020 to 2050 period is around $2.685 trillion. The actual flow seen during the 2018 to 2021 period was $80.6 billion

articles.summary: The Supreme Court on Monday ordered the Uttarakhand government to place before it a comprehensive account of all persons occupying forest land in Rishikesh

articles.title: How US attack on Venezuela impacts India's stock market, crude oil bill, economy
articles.summary: The US attack on Venezuela is creating a dichotomy of sorts for India, as the regime change is less about macroeconomics and more about hard cash.

articles.title: Childcare emerges as key HR focus under Social Security Code
articles.summary: India Inc is boosting childcare support as the Social Security Code nears. Nearly 60% of companies have increased budgets for crèches and daycare. This move aims to retain talent and promote workforce diversity. Childcare benefits are now a top HR priority for working parents. The government's initiative strengthens existing provisions for parental support.

articles.title: NGT directs to issue notice to Centre, U.P. govt. on ‘violations’ near Taj Mahal
articles.summary: According to the applicant, as per the Supreme Court, any tree felling within a 5 km aerial distance from the Taj Mahal requires prior permission of the top court, irrespective of the number of trees involved

articles.title: India’s fiscal fault lines between Centre and states return to the spotlight
articles.summary: Recent changes to India's rural job guarantee scheme have brought back into the spotlight long-running disputes between the Union government and states on how financial resources should be shared.

articles.summary: The Central government announced on Tuesday, December 30, that India has surpassed Japan to become the world's fourth-largest economy with a size of USD 4.18 trillion

articles.title: Govt keeps small savings interest rates unchanged for the March quarter
articles.summary: The government has kept interest rates for popular small savings schemes such as the Public Provident Fund (PPF) and the National Savings Certificate (NSC) unchanged for the eighth consecutive quarter.

articles.summary: The Opposition criticised the Centre for ‘silent submission’ after Senator Lindsay Graham quoted the private conversation to claim that punitive levies worked.

articles.title: NBCC bags ₹134-crore contracts for Odisha education infrastructure projects
articles.summary: NBCC India Ltd received work orders worth ₹134.05 crore from Maharaja Sriram Chandra Bhanja Deo University and Odisha School Programme Authority, following earlier ₹220.31 crore orders in December. Shares of NBCC (India) Ltd. ended lower on Monday, January 5, by 2.46% at ₹119.65 on the NSE.

articles.title: BMC chief admits mistake in deploying court staff for poll duty; gets HC rap
articles.summary: Admitting it was a "mistake" to overstep his jurisdiction, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) Commissioner Bhushan Gagrani on Monday informed Bombay High Court that he withdrew directives that had asked subordinate court staff to report for election duty.

articles.title: Unopposed Civic Wins Reflect ‘Mature Democracy’: Bawankule
articles.summary: The minister claimed that councilors from the BJP and the Mahayuti alliance parties are being elected unopposed at several places as people’s trust has increased due to the large amount of funds provided and development works being done by the central and state governments.

articles.title: CEC Gyanesh Kumar to meet booth-level officers during Odisha visit ahead of electoral roll revision
articles.summary: The interaction with booth-level officers comes as the Election Commission prepares for a state-wide Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, a process that hinges on extensive house-to-house verification and accurate voter data collection at the grassroots level.

AP, however, argues the project utilizes excess floodwater and has Telangana's prior consent, calling the opposition an attempt to stall farmer-friendly initiatives.

articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India will assume responsibility for the Delhi government’s banking operations and rupee public debt from January 9, 2026.

articles.summary: Retailers Association of India urges Union Budget 2026–27 to boost consumption, ease credit, simplify GST, support digital payments and enact National Retail Policy to drive growth and employment.

articles.title: India to grow above 7%, rate cut room limited but rupee outlook improves: Citi India
articles.summary: Citi India expects India to grow above 7% in real terms with inflation near 3.8%, leaving room for limited monetary easing. Chief Economist Samiran Chakraborty said the rupee outlook could improve if the balance of payments turns surplus, while the RBI’s focus in 2026 is likely to be on liquidity and policy guidance rather than aggressive rate cuts.

articles.title: Arunachal GST collection rises 36% in first 9 months of FY26
articles.summary: The collection exceeded the national growth average of 6.8 per cent, reflecting strong economic activity and improved tax compliance in the state, they said.

articles.title: SC dismisses plea for restraining PM Modi from offering 'chadar' at Ajmer Sharif Dargah
articles.summary: The Supreme Court dismissed a plea to restrain Prime Minister Narendra Modi from offering a chadar at Ajmer Sharif Dargah, stating the issue is not justiciable.

articles.title: Umar Khalid's FIRST reaction after SC denies bail in Delhi riots case: 'Ab yahi...'
articles.summary: Student activist Umar Khalid, who was denied bail by the Supreme Court in the Delhi riots case, has become hopeless as he said that now jail has become his life. Banjyosna Lahiri, Khalid's partner, shared that Khalid was happy and relieved for the co-accused who were granted bail, despite his own denial. Sharing Khalid's reaction on X, Lahiri wrote, "I am really happy for the others, who got bail! So relieved, Umar said. "I'll come tomorrow for Mulaqat", I replied. "Good good, aa jana. Ab yahi zindagi hai".

articles.title: Muscle tissue damage, hormone imbalances: Hard workouts can lead to overtraining syndrome
articles.summary: Stressing the body repeatedly without sufficient rest and recovery can flip progress. It can also leave you more susceptible to stress fractures, chronic tendonitis and other overuse injuries.

articles.title: Unacademy rolls back Esop changes for former employees

The test preparation startup had cut down the time to within 30 days of leaving the company, which had led to a backlash on social media by several former employees.

articles.title: Govt weighs shift to NDP from GDP as key metric of economy
articles.summary: India is looking at Net Domestic Product as a key economic indicator. This move aligns with United Nations' SNA 2025 guidelines. NDP accounts for asset depreciation and resource depletion, offering a clearer picture of economic costs. The statistics ministry is preparing for this change, with implementation planned for 2029-30. A revised GDP base year is also coming soon.

articles.title: Indian envoy sought tariff relief over reduced Russian oil purchases, US Senator Lindsey Graham claims
articles.summary: US Senator Lindsey Graham said Indian Ambassador to the United States Vinay Mohan Kwatra told him last month that India was buying less Russian oil and urged him to ask President Donald Trump to ease a 25% tariff. Speaking aboard Air Force One, Graham said the issue dominated their discussion.

articles.title: India Budget 2026: Schemes on cards to give women more financial muscle

articles.title: High-end and luxury housing power Pune realty growth in 2025: Cushman & Wakefield
articles.summary: Pune’s housing market stayed strong in 2025 with nearly 44,000 launches, driven by a sharp rise in high-end and luxury homes. Premium projects dominated supply, lifting capital values and expanding activity in North and North-East corridors. Robust demand from IT hubs and ongoing infrastructure upgrades continue to support market momentum.

articles.title: Markets stuck in a range as FPI caution caps upside; midcaps may see broader participation: Abhay Agarwal
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are consolidating near record highs, supported by domestic flows but hindered by a lack of foreign investment. articles.title: EXIM Bank starts 2026 with $1 billion bond issue: Bankers
articles.summary: EXIM Bank of India has successfully raised one billion US dollars through its dual-tranche bond issue. The bank sold ten-year bonds at five percent and thirty-year bonds at five point seven five percent. Strong demand allowed for aggressive pricing on these longer-duration bonds. Proceeds will fund overseas investments and capital goods imports.

articles.title: A new sunrise for cities? Budget to push for financial autonomy

articles.title: Why ETFs aren't always cheaper than index mutual funds
articles.summary: ETFs appear cheaper due to lower expense ratios, but total ownership costs include bid-ask spreads paid on every transaction. For regular investors, these invisible transaction costs often outweigh the expense ratio advantage.

articles.summary: Paytm has allotted over 1.88 lakh equity shares to employees upon exercising stock options under its Esop 2019 scheme. articles.title: India’s palm oil imports hit 8-month low in December
articles.summary: India's palm oil imports dropped significantly in December, reaching an eight-month low. This decline was driven by reduced winter demand and refiners opting for soyoil and sunflower oil. Total edible oil imports saw an increase due to these rival oil purchases. This shift could impact global oil inventories and prices.

This move supports India's goal to boost the rupee's global use and reduce dollar reliance. SBI's Tel Aviv branch is ready for these transactions, allowing Israeli businesses to pay and receive rupees.

India became the largest buyer of discounted Russian seaborne crude after the Ukraine war began in 2022, drawing criticism from Western nations that say the trade supports Moscow’s war effort.

Also, India-based applicants skew toward founders, operators, and students, with relatively fewer candidates from a finance background.

While international demand offered a bright spot, business confidence declined, reaching its lowest in over three years. A benign inflation environment, however, bodes well for future competition and job creation.

Imports rose 120% from a year earlier, while domestic urea output declined 3.7% to 19.75 million tonnes. Overall urea sales increased 2.3% to 25.40 million tonnes, indicating higher demand.

The site now reaches 60% of UK internet users, with strong growth among young and female audiences. Partnerships with Google and OpenAI, GenZ seeking real advice and plus live sports discussion, have driven traffic.
